column1: The typical interview process is pretty short
column2: and is structured as thus:

column1: HR Screening (30 minutes): A phone screen with a recruiter to make sure expectations are aligned.Fit Interview (30 minutes): A short call with a consulting manager to get to know you and explore how Artefact and you might fit together.Data Science Interview (1 hour): An interview with our technical manager divided into 3 parts. (1) Behavioral questions (e.g. what is your experience? what type of job do you want to have?); (2) Data science scenarios to check your general knowledge about data science; (3) A real-world data science use case that we try to solve together.Take Home (flexible): We'll give you a real-world use case
column2: with anonymized data and a business problem. You'll have as much time as you want to complete the assignment (we typically give 1 week
column3: although we observe that it takes about a few hours to complete). When you're done
column4: we'll schedule a slot for you to present your results to a technical manager and a consulting manager. We'll also review your code. We sometimes skip the take home for exceptional candidates.

column1: The typical interview process is pretty short
column2: and is structured as thus:

column1: HR Screening (30 minutes): A phone screen with a recruiter to make sure expectations are aligned.Fit Interview (30 minutes): A short call with a consulting manager to get to know you and explore how Artefact and you might fit together.Data Science Interview (1 hour): An interview with our technical manager divided into 3 parts. (1) Behavioral questions (e.g. what is your experience? what type of job do you want to have?); (2) Data science scenarios to check your general knowledge about data science; (3) A real-world data science use case that we try to solve together.Take Home (flexible): We'll give you a real-world use case
column2: with anonymized data and a business problem. You'll have as much time as you want to complete the assignment (we typically give 1 week
column3: although we observe that it takes about a few hours to complete). When you're done
column4: we'll schedule a slot for you to present your results to a technical manager and a consulting manager. We'll also review your code. We sometimes skip the take home for exceptional candidates.

column1: The typical interview process is pretty short
column2: and is structured as thus:

column1: HR Screening (30 minutes): A phone screen with a recruiter to make sure expectations are aligned.Fit Interview (30 minutes): A short call with a consulting manager to get to know you and explore how Artefact and you might fit together.Data Science Interview (1 hour): An interview with our technical manager divided into 3 parts. (1) Behavioral questions (e.g. what is your experience? what type of job do you want to have?); (2) Data science scenarios to check your general knowledge about data science; (3) A real-world data science use case that we try to solve together.Take Home (flexible): We'll give you a real-world use case
column2: with anonymized data and a business problem. You'll have as much time as you want to complete the assignment (we typically give 1 week
column3: although we observe that it takes about a few hours to complete). When you're done
column4: we'll schedule a slot for you to present your results to a technical manager and a consulting manager. We'll also review your code. We sometimes skip the take home for exceptional candidates.

column1: HR Screening (30 minutes): A phone screen with a recruiter to make sure expectations are aligned.Fit Interview (30 minutes): A short call with a consulting manager to get to know you and explore how Artefact and you might fit together.Data Science Interview (1 hour): An interview with our technical manager divided into 3 parts. (1) Behavioral questions (e.g. what is your experience? what type of job do you want to have?); (2) Data science scenarios to check your general knowledge about data science; (3) A real-world data science use case that we try to solve together.Take Home (flexible): We'll give you a real-world use case
column2: with anonymized data and a business problem. You'll have as much time as you want to complete the assignment (we typically give 1 week
column3: although we observe that it takes about a few hours to complete). When you're done
column4: we'll schedule a slot for you to present your results to a technical manager and a consulting manager. We'll also review your code. We sometimes skip the take home for exceptional candidates.

column1: As a Biostatistician (m/f/d) you will support the Pharma Technical Development department in applying statistical methods to develop and characterize production processes in the best possible way.

You will be part of a team of 9 people - the Datalab. The team assists with statistical planning and analysis of experimental data sets. It also develops data products that facilitate and accelerate the development of our production processes. We network with all development functions and proactively seek solutions that increase their efficiency. We strive for agile implementation of these solutions and expect engagement within our self-organized projects.
You will perform and support the following duties:

Design and analysis of experiments to optimize production processes and develop efficient biotechnological processesSupport in the analysis and interpretation of process data (e.g. multivariate data evaluations
column2: chemometric evaluations
column3: root cause analysis)Development of new statistical methods and machine learning algorithms for commercial applicationsSupporting regulatory submissions of new molecules for the marketplaceTraining in statistics and data analysis for engineers and scientistsAdvance statistical thinking and decision making in engineering development

column1: Our goal is to overcome language barriers and bring cultures closer together.
What distinguishes us from other companies?
DeepL (formerly Linguee) was founded by developers and researchers. We focus on the development of new
column2: exciting products

column1: When we tell people about DeepL as an employer

column1: What will you be doing at DeepL?
You will be part of the highly motivated team that runs DeepL's analytics platform. Our growing team is a cross-functional mix of Engineers
column2: Data Analysts
column3: Data Scientists and Product Owners working towards our common goal of leveraging our user data. Based on the vast amount of data that we gather from our more than 100 million users your role will focus on measuring and understanding the impact of our product on the user. For example you will analyse the performance of AB tests and Marketing campaigns or model and forecast retention and expected revenue of our users. For doing this job you will be heavily involved with our in-house analytics codebase which is based on Python and SQL. Through your work you will make a significant impact on our company goal of building the best possible translation experience and overcome language barriers.

column1: Senior Data Scientist for Product Supply (m/f/d)

The Decision Science unit at Bayer Pharmaceutical is a one stop shop for all enterprise advanced analytics projects. We work across all functions in Bayer from R&D to marketing & sales to product supply. We solve hard analytical problems and build solutions together with our Bayer colleagues with the mission to improve the overall efficiency and decision making in the company. If you are interested in joining a dynamic team applying bleeding edge advanced analytics algorithms to all kind of data types we would like to hear from you.

Lead projects and other data scientists applying LEAN and agile approach to deliver fit-for-purpose solutions  Support business and innovation projects in the Product Supply business function within Bayer Pharmaceuticals  Establish strong link with stakeholders in the business to help shape and execute the digital agenda strategy  Collaborate with Data Scientists in Product Supply Pharmaceuticals as well as production and quality teams to investigate production behavior and develop data strategies to improve product performance and ultimately quality outcomes  Perform complex simulation
column2: optimization
column3: modelling and machine learning research integrating multi-layered data models from internal and external sources  Develop and train members of the Data Science team  Maintain awareness of state-of-the-art application of AI in life science industries and research  Create opportunities for data product development by identifying pain points in the business to improve efficiency and decision making  Lead scale up activities transforming data science prototypes to end to end solutions by leveraging skills across a global DT&IT organization  Search and explore external opportunities with academia and new solution vendors  Publish innovative methodologies and scientific discoveries in peer reviewed journals

column2: you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology.
